DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Serving or tending to restore health; a remedy._The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases._To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion._The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Serving or tending to restore health; a remedy.:The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.:To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: Serving or tending to restore health; a remedy.
The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.
